You can manually star an INCIDENT but you also can add an starring ALERT configuration.

comments.content: Odd enough the fact that the documentation says you can create an incident starring configuration, but the Cortex XDR Console says "Alert starring configuration", I'd change the answer to "BD" just because that's what the documentation says about it and the exam has probably been created from that.

Selected Answer: BD

incident after reviewing it, or you can create an incident-starring conﬁguration that automatically categorizes and stars incidents when a related alert contains the speciﬁc attributes that you decide are

https://docs-cortex.paloaltonetworks.com/r/Cortex-XDR/Cortex-XDR-Prevent-Administrator-Guide/Manage-Incident-Starring

You can manually star an incident after reviewing it, or you can create an incident starring configuration that automatically categorizes and stars incidents when a related alert contains the specific attributes that you decide are important.
The correct answer is B and D. From the Study Guide. Incident related starring
AD: You can star incidents in two ways: You can manually star an incident after reviewing it, or you can create an incident starring configuration
I am confused here, the documentation says to create an incident starring configuration, but in the configuration setting it says "Create New Alert Starring Configuration"
I guess B and D are correct.

You can manually star an incident after reviewing it, or you can create an incident starring configuration that automatically categorizes and stars incidents when a related alert contains the specific attributes that you decide are important.

questions.question_text: You can star security events in which two ways? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Select
Save to Widget Library
to pivot to the Widget Library and generate a custom widget based on the query results. from admin guide pg. 212
D - SAVE AS WITH 2 choices only 'QUERY library' or 'widget to library'
its actually "save as" then 4 choices - BIOC Rule - Correlation Rule - Query to Library- Widget to Library.

questions.question_text: When creating a custom XQL query in a dashboard, how would a user save that XQL query to the Widget Library?

choices.B: This isn’t supported, you have to exit the dashboard and go into the Widget Library first to create it.
choices.C: Click on “Save to Action Center” in the dashboard and you will be prompted to give the query a name and description.
choices.D: Click on “Save to Widget Library” in the dashboard and you will be prompted to give the query a name and description.
choices.A: Click the three dots on the widget and then choose “Save” and this will link the query to the Widget Library.
